content.description: Sit start at a large two handed edge with small feet and reach for small right and left hand crimps before a slopey top-out. The direct top out on the slopers is V2, or use the large L shaped hold on the right to top out for V1+.
content.location: Just right of the small roof for Undercling Crack.

content.description: The obvious path of least resistance straight up to the top out. Every move features at least one big positive hold.
content.protection: Pad, spotter. A pretty good landing area.
content.location: The far right wall (northwest) of the Bayou area, on the train tracks side of the park. Top out and walk the trail to your right to return to the base.

content.description: Start straight up middle of slab with not much for feet or hands to horizontal crimp line. Continue straight up on tiny crimps and chossy sloper crux. Avoid vertical incut for feet and right hand jugs for v4
content.location: Right of slab crack left of slab dihedral.

content.description: Start the easy crack problem then traverse right on a undercling flake with smears for feet. Classic granite climbing.
content.location: On the face around the corner from the dihedral. Good landing.

content.description: A right to left low traverse on crimps and dime edges for feet. Your feet should stay about a foot off the ground the whole time until you get to the undercling mini roof crack. Continue to traverse left on uderclings into the V0 warm up crack.
content.location: Right of the undercling crack problem.

content.description: Climb the thin lieback flake to a right-leaning seam. Join PI Fight for the same questionable tree stump top out.

Start Mind Memo, after the dyno, cut left

on slopers and pinches, avoid

the slab at left. From a positive incut for the

left, launch up the hanging arête, making a

committing move to the horn. From the horn climb past square

cut edges, using the arête for the left-hand.
content.protection: Multiple pads. (although they may not be too helpful)

content.description: Start at Slab Crack and traverse over putrid water till you gain the arête then follow it to the highball finale.
content.protection: Pads wont help. TR options. Exciting!!! Don't fall into the sharp tree limbs at the bottom!
content.location: Left of Slab Crack shares arête with Bambi Arête.

content.description: Obvious, sometimes dirty crack in the slab. Highball with horrible landing. Pad may help.
content.location: Left of Graffiti dihedral

content.description: Climb the left-facing book to a questionable top out using the old tree stump.

Start crouched on small

sloping edges, avoiding the slab at left. Using a left-hand

pinch and the arête for your right, dyno to

the sloping ledge and climb the right-facing

mini-dihedral to a bucket just below the lip.

Commit to the scary top-out!
content.location: Arete adjacent to the large cottonwood tree.

content.description: Climb the rightmost arete on decent holds.
content.location: The brown, triangle shaped boulder near Spider Soul and Pie Fight

content.description: Start with both hands on the rounded jug, make a big committing move with over twenty feet of air below you to the sloping lip.
content.protection:
None for the highball boulder problem.

Like most routes in the Bayou, a toprope anchor can be rigged with trad gear.
content.location: right after the pacific street wall walk up the trail about 15 feet

content.description: Shares start with Graffiti Dihedral (low-right). Work left and up, crossing entire face topping out high left. Utilizing the  horizontal crimp line for hands ONLY. Cross thru Slab Crack, continue working left and up through easy highball slab. Deer Creek's longest line.
Start at the matched at the right most corner of the boulder then make your way left using heels to a good topout
content.location: 10 feet from the parking lot. If you are at the parking lot look to the left side and you should see it by the cluster of rocks.

content.description: Start on the highball crack left of Bambi then break right trying to keep your ass off the ledge. Continue to traverse right till you can mantel up. Pretty fun problem.
content.location: Left of Bambi.

content.description: AIRY HIGHBALL!!! I have determined this a V4 - but the book says V3 climb the large dihedral to incuts , then traverse left under the roof to a large pinch. Reach back and right to the horn/jug. Straight-arm and palm the horn to reach a SMALL! incut crimp in the small dihedral left of the hanging arete. Putting your feet up to the horn and stemming onto the slab, make a DELICATE move out to the hanging arete with plenty of air beneath you. Reach to positive lip.
content.protection:
I would advise a rope, this is extremely airy and after the first couple of moves there is nothing that a pad would protect.

I used a BD #4-5 to protect at the top. There is also this cool anchor at the top that I have used but bring a few runners to avoid rope drag, because the edge is SHARP!
content.location: The obvious roof next to the splitter crack.

content.description:
Obvious dihedral..... don't fall, or get a TR.

Sometime was referred to as White Power Arete for the horrible graffiti. The original swastika has since been tagged over with anti-nazi sentiments.
content.protection: pad?? Probably wont help. TR options.
content.location: Right of Slab Crack

content.description: Often waterlogged, starts in swamp left of small runnel. Stand start, up left leaning rail to crimpers. Awkward feet and a big reach to sloping lip makes for a great problem. Runnel is off and watch out for shoe bath!
content.location: Vertical face of rock feature that juts out into the swamp. Straight out towards swamp(East)from PI Fight.

content.description: Use the slopey rail for your hands until you can top out on Bluebird.
content.location: The boulder near PI fight and Spider Soul

content.description: Start on the overhanging corner on blocky holds. Use pinches, slopers, and a right hand sidepull crimp to surmount the bulge.
content.location: Left of Bambi Arête just right of the approach gully.

content.description: Move up on positive slopers to crimp rail. High right foot leads to heady crux before slaby top out.
content.location: To the left of warm up crack.

content.description: Climb the face directly left of the are really without using the holds on the arete.
content.location: Left of Maroon.

content.description: Sit start the left leaning sharp arête. Continue up and left over a bad landing to a heady mantel.
content.location: Left of Slab Crack. Shares the same arête as Smear it On. Completely different approach. Go down into the pit from an obvious gully right next to Comfortably Numb.

content.description: Start directly below the top out of Bambi Arête. The left wall is off but the crack is on. Use your right hand (somehow) on sloping crimps on the face to a desperate top out over a less than perfect landing.
content.location: Direct start to Bambi Arête.
